Detailed Description

Interface with a keyboard.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef unsigned char Code
 

This type is used to represent key codes.

Key codes can be obtained from their string representation using the keyCode() method: 

  Keyboard kb;
  ...     // keyboard initialization
  Keyboard::Code keyA = kb->keyCode("A");
  if (kb.isPressed(keyA)) {
      ... // key 'A' is pressed
      }
String representations of most keys are straight forward ("A", "1", "Space", ect.), but some could be tricky to guess (and furthermore theu are case sensitive). So the easiest way to get string representations for any key, use the activeKeys() method together with the keyString() method : 
  Keyboard kb;
  kb.init();
  while (acquisition) {
      kb.update();
      std::vector<Keyboard::Code> keys = kb.activeKeys();
      for(unsigned int i=0; i<keys.size(); i++)
          std::cout << kb.keyString(keys[i]) << endl;
      }
  kb.close();

Member Function Documentation

std::vector< Keyboard::Code > activeKeys (   )  const
 

Returns the list of keys that were pressed during last update.

Returns:
the list of all the keys that were pressed during last update.

void close (   ) 
 

Closes keyboard interface.

Needs to be called when this interface is not needed anymore, before destroying this object.

bool exists (  char *  s  )  const
 

Tests if the specified string corresponds to any existing key representation.

Parameters:
s the case sensitive string representation to test.
Returns:
true iff the specified string corresponds to an existing key representation.

void grab (   )  const
 

Grabs the keyboard events.

Subsequent key events are not transmitted to the window manager.

Warning:
be careful with this feature, it will block even the Ctrl-C event is blocked so using a kill command in an other shell (opened using the mouse) would be necessary if the program freezes in this mode.

bool init (   ) 
 

Initialization of the keyboard interface.

Returns:
true on success, false if some error occured.

Tests if the specified specific key was just pressed.

Parameters:
key the key to test.
Returns:
true iff the specified key has been pressed between the two last updates.

Converts the (case sensitive) string representation of a key into its corresponding code.

Parameters:
s the case sensitive string representation to convert.
Returns:
the corresponding key code. Result if unspecified if exists(s) returns false.

void ungrab (   )  const
 

Stops grabing keyboard events.

Needs to be called to end keyboard grabbing after a call to grab().

void update (   ) 
 

Updates keyboard state.

Needs to be called before any state querying method.
